Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 125 views

Job description

  • WGEA employer of choice
  • Innovative and flexible work environment
  • Be part of a thriving ASX listed top 100 company

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.

In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The role
At carsales, we have one of Melbourne fastest-growing iOS team and are always on the hunt for talented iOS developers to join our technology team.

The roles will focus on designing and implementing apps for one of our key customer platforms and with experience across the full software development lifecycle, you will work closely with stakeholders across the business to build great apps.

As we continue to grow our presence in Latin American, over time these roles will play an important part in developing and delivering products for our international businesses

What You'll Do
  • Design and develop new product features and enhancements
  • Integrate the app with Carsales APIs
  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks, address memory leaks
  • Investigate and use cutting-edge technologies
  • Champion design and code reviews
  • Write tests for your code, or if you prefer, write code for your tests
  • Help more junior developers become a great developer like you
  • Turn guesstimates into great estimates
Experience and qualifications
  • Strong team-oriented mindset
  • Solid experience with Swift and Objective C
  • Experience building applications for iOS Devices on high traffic networks
  • Strong knowledge of Apple's iOS Frameworks, and networking frameworks
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with Design Patterns, Object Oriented Programming
  • Able to prototype ideas, present them to others and mentor other team members
  • Working knowledge of Agile Development and/or an enthusiasm to learn
  • Unit-testing know-how required, experience with TDD or BDD a plus.

Why Apply?
Carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance and reward, and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at Carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply.

--

And just a quick one…
Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

[

Warehousing & Logistics Supervisor, Castrol - Spotswood

Company Name BP Company Location Spotswood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 373 views

Job description


As part of BP, Castrol is widely acknowledged as the world's leading specialist provider of Lubricant solutions. Although best known for our expertise in developing lubricants for the auto, Industrial and resource sectors, we also produce lubricants that directly affect our daily lives in other ways such as in gas and electricity production, transport industries, construction, and the marine sector.

We are now recruiting for a Warehouse & Logistics Supervisor to join our team in Melbourne. Reporting to the Customer Fulfilment Manager, the primary purpose of this role is to oversee the movement of stock from our warehouses to third party logistics providers and to our customers. the role will be based at both the Castrol plant and warehouse in Spotswood and at a third party warehouse located in Derrimut.




Key Responsibilities:


* Leading a small team of distribution personnel
* Review the effectiveness of our scheduling process and implement improvements where possible
* Schedule and manage vehicle movements to ensure product is delivered to customers on time
* Prioritises work assignments and handles multiple tasks, including problem solving, to ensure all distribution assigned task sets are completed, as scheduled
* Maintaining compliance with all company and regulatory health, safety and environmental policies and standards
* Effectively planning resources across sites to meet business and customer needs
* Reviewing customer service reports to ensure stock-outs are minimized and implementing corrective actions when stock shortages do occur


Essential Skills & Experience:

In order to be considered for this role, applicants must; hold a current driver's licence; have deep experience in warehousing and distribution in a manufacturing environment; have proven experience in the implementation of distribution processes; have some prior project experience and; be expert at managing health, safety and environmental risks as they pertain to warehousing and logistics.

At all times your priority will be to ensure that all tasks undertaken by you and your team are done so in accordance with company and regulatory health, safety and environmental policies and standards.

Industry

  • Oil & Energy

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Supply Chain

Your primary role will be to elicit, analyse and document Yooralla’s business requirements and processes to support the evolution of Yooralla’s business systems. Business Analyst

Company Name Intelematics Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 633 views

Job description

Intelematics is Australia's leading provider of vehicle-related connected mobility services.


We work with large automotive industry leaders and car clubs to enhance the driving experience - giving motorists access to motoring content, telematics and smart dashboard services; making every drive safer, more efficient and more enjoyable.


It's an exciting time to be part of a dynamic, passionate team working on some of the most innovative telematics products and services in the market today.


The Opportunity


We have a fantastic opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our team!


The successful candidate will be involved in...


  • Gathering and presenting statistical data to support reporting obligations and the development of product roadmaps and project plans
  • Analysing workflows to create process maps and isolate areas of potential improvements
  • Converting business and customer requirements into epics and stories that provide clear acceptance criteria
  • Developing functional specifications and documenting desired outcomes of system enhancement and development
  • Producing technical specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms to analyst programmers/project team
  • Aligning technical solutions in collaboration with technical architects and engineers
  • Coordinating User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
  • Performing UAT on completed stories and bridging communication between business and technology
  • Preparing material and providing training and assistance to end-users following implementation
  • Facilitating workshops, kick-offs, walk throughs, agile ceremonies and other events
  • Assisting the product team in grooming the backlog and estimating stories and features
  • Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommending optimal business practices, system functionalities and behaviours
  • Identifying risks, issues, blockers and proactively raises them with Product Manager, the team and stakeholders


Benefits and perks

  • Work with passionate, collaborative and diverse teams
  • Work in an autonomous and growth focused Agile environment
  • Take advantage of our commitment to your ongoing learning and development
  • Flexible ways of working available
  • Professional Educational Assistance available
  • Paid Parental Leave available
  • Receive generous discounts on RACV products and services (Insurance products, Roadside Assist, Club Membership, Accommodation, Movie Tickets, Airport Parking and Car Hire)
  • Receive new vehicle discounts via our client partners

Skills and experience


We are looking for someone who...

  • Is tertiary qualified in Business, Science, Engineering or Economics
  • Is certified in delivery execution and it's governance, (or who can demonstrate evidence of professional development and relevant experience)
  • Has 3 - 5 years experience in IT, with at least 2 years' experience in a software development environment
  • Is able to communicate with both end-users and IT employees at all levels of the organisation
  • Has technical knowledge of programming, system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts
  • Can demonstrate sound technical specification writing/documentation skills


If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you - click APPLY now!\xa0

And don't forget to follow us to stay up to date on company news and career opportunities!

Third Party Claims Triage Officer

Company Name QBE Insurance Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 115 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Role: Third Party Claims Triage Officer x 3

Type: Full Time, Permanent

Location: Melbourne CBD

Applications Close Friday 7th September

QBE is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as Australia's largest international insurance and Reinsurance Company, with operations in 37 countries around the world.

We offer you a dynamic workplace culture, one that values and leverages the unique ideas, capabilities and experiences you bring irrespective of where you are in the world. We believe this strengthens our ability to deliver on our business goals, particularly as it relates to innovation growth and our focus on customers.

The Opportunity

We currently have an exciting opportunity for 3 customer focused individuals to join a newly created third party management team on a permanent full-time basis.

You will aim to convert third parties to our accredited repair network while also offering the most appropriate mobility solution.

This is a rare entry level role into the insurance industry. The role provides an interesting opportunity for an individual with a background in motor insurance who has strong communication and negotiation skills.

The key responsibilities for this role include the following, but not limited to:
  • Convert third parties to our accredited smash repair network
  • Identify suitable mobility solutions for third parties
  • Determine liability
  • Collect necessary information to progress a claim
  • Provide a valued service to third parties, increasing satisfaction
  • Communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
  • Improve QBE’s reputation to promptly pay valid claims and provide quality customer service
  • Reduce claims life cycle
  • Reduce QBE’s third-party exposure
The key skills required for this role include the following:
  • Individuals with great experience in Customer Service, Call Centre or a Sales environment
  • Claims handling experience is a bonus but not essential
  • Experience with motor insurance is desirable
  • Ability to communicate effectively with a positive and upbeat attitude
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent negotiation skills
  • The ability to prioritize and balance multiple tasks
Benefits

At QBE you will be provided with a competitive remuneration structure and benefits in an environment that offers support and encourages career development and learning.

We Offer a Range Of Benefits Including
  • Paid Parental Leave (inclusive of paid superannuation during this time)
  • Secondment Opportunities
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Paid volunteer leave
  • Purchased leave
  • Product discounts
  • Superannuation matching
If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager before applying.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Number Of Openings

3

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

834776989:
[

Senior Adviser, Safety and Wellbeing

Company Name Court Services Victoria Company Location 223 William St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Exciting opportunity to proactively develop and deliver strategies and improvements to enable implementation of safe OHS systems.


  • Develop and implement initiatives arising from recent internal OHS audit
  • Diverse and challenging role
  • Exciting new VPS Grade 5, 12 month opportunity (VPS Grade 4 role also available!)
\xa0

About us

Court Services Victoria (CSV) is an independent statutory body corporate that provides corporate and administrative services that support judicial independence in the administration of justice in Victoria.


Within CSV, Jurisdiction Services provides support services across a range of corporate functions to the Supreme Court; the County Court; the Magistrate's Court; the Children's Court; and the Coroner's Court, as well as the Victorian Civil and Administrative Tribunal (VCAT), the Judicial College of Victoria and the Judicial Commission of Victoria.


This role operates within the Workplace Relations team in People and Culture (P&C) branch of JS. The Safety and Wellbeing team is responsible for ensuring CSV is meeting its responsibilities under the Occupational Health and Safety Act 2004\xa0and the Workplace Injury Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2013.


About the role

The Senior Adviser, Safety and Wellbeing (JS0234) is primarily responsible for providing high level advice and assistance at an organisational and operational level to support the planning, implementation, monitoring and reporting of health, safety and wellbeing processes and improvement activities. Specifically, the incumbent will play a key role in development and implementation of a range of occupational health and safety (OHS) improvements to CSV systems of work to deliver against recommendations from a recent audit of the management of OHS. The role is also responsible for case managing complex WorkCover claims and return to work plans, as well as providing leadership and specialist advice to CSV managers and staff regarding these matters and broader health, safety and wellbeing matters and initiatives.


About you

You will have previously implemented strategies and improvements to procedures, processes and systems of work, with demonstrated knowledge of relevant legislation, regulations and standards as well as experience in risk management and management of complex WorkCover claims.


The position interacts with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders and is required to utilise strong relationship management and communication skills to improve health safety and wellbeing performance and to support resolution of challenging and complex OHS issues.


How to apply

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description or contact Gayle Sherwell on 0439 108 660.


To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button, ensuring you include a resume and short covering letter in your application.


A new fixed-term VPS Grade 4 Safety and Wellbeing Adviser position has also been advertised - please refer to www.careers.vic.gov.au for more information.


Applications close: Tuesday 4 September 2018.

Agile Project Manager

Company Name Cengage Australia Company Location 80 Dorcas Street Level 7, South Melbourne, VIC 3205, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 202 views

Job description

What we need;


An Agile Project Manager who has experience working closely with digital and platform teams. \xa0You will have experience guiding and mentoring teams that are in the early stages of transitioning from the more traditional waterfall methods of delivery to Agile practices. You will also have a strong appreciation of the strengths of waterfall/sequential workflow practices in order to successfully work across teams to implement change where required. \xa0

\xa0

Our team is committed to transforming to agile practices (where applicable) and will be looking for you to partner with them to guide and direct this process.

\xa0

Responsibilities:


In this position, you will need to take the time to understand our business needs and product requirements by working with content development teams across various publishing lists.

\xa0

You will collaborate with product managers, designers, developers and production, plus multiple stakeholders outside of our product team, to ensure transformation is properly understood and being applied as pragmatically as possible.

\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Capture project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders
  • Maintain Cengage Digital Product Workflow and accompanying RACI
  • Support the Digital Product Workflow throughout each development phase of the product lifecycle
  • Understand technical deliverables and help encourage completion within iterations
  • Coordinate and facilitate projects/programs using Agile practices, processes and tools
  • Run release planning sessions and retrospectives on projects
  • Regularly monitor sprint progress and take proactive measures to achieve deadlines and objectives
  • Support the completion of stories and intern Epics in Jira
  • Support User story mapping to ensure product vision and clear acceptance criteria
  • Promote, support and enable continuous improvement amongst project teams
  • Measure ‘team health’ using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Provide regular reporting against performance and effort
  • Foster discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution
  • Connect with product managers to ensure project goals and requirements are met
  • Be the hub of communication for the project


We also need you to:

  • Collaborate closely with the Creative Director to advise best practices for the team
  • Have an ability to summarise complex topics for non-technical customers both verbally and visually
  • Work with other project managers in implementing Agile development approaches where applicable
  • Create and maintain process and project documentation
  • Coach, educate and mentor fellow team members regarding Agile practices, principles and mindset

\xa0

Cengage is a global business; your role will also be required to liaise with Agile coaching peers from our international offices to help implement best practice.

\xa0

Qualifications, knowledge and skills:


To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

  • Proven work experience as a Project Manager or another role that promotes strong understanding of Software development lifecycle
  • Proven work experience promoting Agile methodologies and supporting tools
  • Proven hands on Jira/Confluence experience
  • Experience with Scrum, Kanban and Lean methodologies
  • Demonstrate strong knowledge and background with Agile concepts
  • Experience with Waterfall or involvement converting teams from Waterfall to an agile approach
  • Excellent leadership, communication and collaboration skills
  • Experience working in a large organization with diverse stakeholders, complexities, dependencies, multiple teams

\xa0

This is a crucial and integral role and an exciting time to join Cengage. \xa0You will be starting at a time when you can make a significant impact to the organisation and influence the transformation of the digital projects. \xa0

\xa0

A detailed job description is available on our website for interested candidates.

\xa0

Applications quoting reference no. APM5218\xa0should be submitted to\xa0the Human Resources Manager,\xa0via email aust.employment@cengage.com\xa0or our website www.cengage.com.au

by Friday 7 September\xa02018.

Risk and Resilience Lead

Company Name SACS Consulting Company Location Docklands, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Strong Strategy Focus
  • Implementation of New ERMS
  • Remuneration Package Negotiable Low $100,000’s

\xa0

The Bureau of Meteorology is one of Australia’s most important government agencies. Their 24x7 services are crucial to the safety and productivity of Australians. The organisation has recently updated its strategy and has embarked on the development of a significant new Enterprise Risk Management System which is driving the organisation’s approach to risk and resilience.

\xa0

This role will work closely with the General Manager as deputy and will have a key role in rolling out the new ERMS process across the organisation. This role will require significant travel to the various sites of the BOM across the country. Internal relationship management will be a key focus of this role as you build relationships with various business units and consult and collaborate with them to optimise the risk and resilience practices of the organisation. As part of this undertaking you will help design and deliver training on risk and resilience to a wide range of stakeholders.

\xa0

You have substantial experience in risk and resilience and are well versed in risk management and emergency response methodologies. Job description

\xa0 Join one of the fastest growing companies in Australia!

Life-Space is fast becoming one of the top probiotic brands on the world stage, increasing their global footprint at a rapid pace. As the leading brand of Evolution Health, we have been ranked in the top ten BRW fastest growing 100 list\xa0for the last two years running, moving from number 7 in 2016 to number 4\xa0in 2017.Life-Space are focussed on innovation and education, making the latest advances in research accessible to all. Our brand values are reflected through Evolution Health’s vibrant culture. We have recently signed an agreement to join China’s No 1 supplements company and there is still plenty of work to do!


The opportunity: Social Media Manager

We are looking for a social media manager to join our team. You will report to the PR and Partnerships Manager and will be responsible for contributing to digital strategies and their execution, from creation of content calendars to writing headlines, launching campaigns, maximising performance and adjusting campaigns. Working collaboratively within the marketing department to develop and implement an audience growth strategy to raise awareness of our brands. Your role may include interstate or international travel for industry and company related events.


Key Responsibilities

  • Contribute to content strategy, assisting with guiding and creating social content.

  • Support our influencer program working cross-functionally with PR
  • Guide and assist with community management.
  • Report on results, interpret data and develop insights and recommendations.

  • 3+ years in social media management
  • Proficient in MS Office, PowerPoint, Excel, Photo and video-editing software
  • Experience with Social Media Platforms (Facebook, twitter, WeChat, Instagram, LinkedIn)

  • Excellent verbal and written communication, writing and editing skills with the capacity to story tell complex concepts
  • Highly creative with a passion for social media content creation
  • Proficiency in WordPress and Google Analytics would be highly regarded.

Full Stack Web Developer

Company Name 99designs Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 142 views

Job description

Are you a software engineer with a passion for web development, who wants to help us connect the world with great graphic design? Do you appreciate the value of clean, well thought-out and reliable code? If you answered yes, great. Read on to learn more about who we are, what we need, and what we can offer you.


About 99designs

99designs is the world’s global creative platform that makes it easier for customers and designers to work together to create designs they love. Our mission is to champion creativity to create opportunities for people around the world. Founded in 2008, 99designs has grown from a small, online forum into a worldwide community of talented designers that is now the go-to solution for businesses, agencies and individuals. Our product is translated into 7 different languages and we've paid out designers in 192 countries.

Backed by Accel Partners (who have also invested in Facebook, Slack, and Dropbox) and Recruit Strategic Partners, 99designs is a dynamic company with offices in Melbourne, Oakland and Berlin. We’re a global team that benefits from bringing together the experiences and viewpoints of a wide range of talented folk around the world.


About the role

On a day to day basis, you will:

  • Make sustainable and high quality technical contributions across all levels of the stack.
  • Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, designers and marketers to identify and solve challenging problems.
  • Work on big projects, debug small production issues, perform infrastructure maintenance tasks and anything else it takes to build and support great software.
  • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively.
  • Analyse and improve application performance and reliability and take part in our on-call roster; "You build it, you run it".


About you

At 99designs we care deeply about diversity and inclusion. We welcome applicants of all types, from all backgrounds that have the skills and experience we're looking for because we know our ability to design and create products for all our customers is largely a sum of the diversity and empathy of our team.


Requirements

  • Minimum 2 years commercial experience with a server-side language like Ruby, PHP or Golang, and eager to learn new languages, frameworks and tools.
  • Experience with React or other recent Javascript frameworks.
  • A positive mindset: equal parts curious, collaborative, and can-do attitude
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills


Bonus points

  • Experience with TypeScript, Apollo and GraphQL.
  • Experience with AWS, Docker and infrastructure as code.
  • A love of open-source, building on the shoulders of giants.
  • Demonstrated design and UX sensibilities.


About working with us

We have plenty of exciting engineering challenges that you could help us solve, from search and matching algorithms to fraud prevention and internationalisation. We care about quality and strive to keep our systems modular and our code clean. We constantly refine our processes and tools with the aim to make developers happy, efficient and able to focus on building great product. We love shipping, continuous delivery is in our DNA. Anyone on the team can deploy to production, and we do so many times a day.


99designs employees enjoy many benefits including:

  • Continual training and learning, conference attendance, in-house mentoring and Bi-weekly R&D days
  • Flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home when you need to
  • Health and wellness programs like yoga, a running club, and quiet spaces
  • A fully stocked kitchen, with an industrial-strength coffee machine, free snacks and weekly lunches
  • An active social club, with events for you and your family
  • Paid parental leave
  • Top-of-the-line Mac gear

Job description

Principal Engineer / Engineering Manager, Global Project Business Utility Scale Solar - Melbourne (Australia)

Leap29 are working closely with a high-tech company which specializes in solar power station solutions (project business; development, investment and EPC). We are looking for an experienced Engineering professional to join the Global Project Business based in Melbourne, Australia. The ideal candidate will be a confident and highly capable, with strong experience in EPC (with focus on design and engineering), and a demonstrated ability to effectively provide sound technical advice, exercise good business judgment, and work with senior management, other colleagues, external stakeholders, customers and regulators, in an international setup. Experience in the solar industry / energy / engineering field is a must

Primary Responsibilities

The successful candidate will have responsibilities that include, but are not limited to
  • Manage the technical team members (internal and external) to execute the project developments (and potential deployment) per commitments and forecasts, and timeline.
  • Supervise and guide design and engineering activities and ensure engineering designs meet local and international standards.
  • Selection of EPC contractors and contract negotiation for upcoming projects. RFP management and EPC selection, EPC contract negotiation, engineering review.
  • Develop and implement an OHS process in the Company.
  • Prepare forecasts and budget for project development across the various markets.
  • Support the design, planning and construction of new Solar racking systems, alterations and extensions to existing products or projects.
  • Support the certification and designing of solar mounting structures so that they are code compliant, safe and effective.
Required Qualifications, Experience And Skills
  • Bachelor or Master's degree in an Engineering Discipline (Electrical is preferred).
  • Minimum of 5 years engineering experience in utility-scale PV or power generation.
  • Advantageous to have experience in OHS aspects.
  • Strong negotiating skills. Ability to negotiate development rights, EPC/O&M agreements and other ancillary agreements, etc.
  • Solid and effective interpersonal and communication skills (including oral, written and visual).
  • Experience engaging with and evaluating equipment vendors and service providers (including engineering firms and EPC contractors). Ability to read & understand electrical, structural, mechanical & architectural drawings.
  • Wide knowledge of relevant regulations and standards (e.g., electrical code, building codes, international design standards).
  • Strong organizational and time management skills; the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines.
  • Technical proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Microsoft Projects.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.

  • Willingness to travel up to 50% or more of the time.

Job description

  • Are you ready to be a part of a high performing team?
  • Work with a company that values collaboration and diversity
  • Contribute to the growth of a thriving community

About The Role

Role Location- 55 Collins Street Docklands VIC

Contract Duration- 12 months

As a Project Business Analyst, you will work with finance and project stakeholders to analyse and synthesise information, understand the organisational context and complete business analysis activities. You will be responsible in the overall documentation and management of the requirements throughout the project. This involves other activities such as testing, process mapping and change transition. You will work within the stakeholder framework of the project and communicate these requirements to key stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of the project’s objectives and benefits.

About You

To be successful in this role, you must possess the following-
  • Relevant Finance services experience
  • Experience in IT processes and methodologies
  • Knowledge in project management lifecycles, disciplines and procedures with experience in working on mid to large sized projects
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate with stakeholders from all levels
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a background in functional requirements writing and gathering
  • Strong presentation and communication skills

About ANZ

At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS088230.

834869329:
[

Academic Products Specialist

Company Name RMIT Online Company Location 235-251 Bourke Street Building 108, Level 4, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 74 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Not your average university – who is RMIT Online?


RMIT Online, a subsidiary of RMIT University is an exciting ‘start-up’ team dedicated to building a “Community of lifelong learners, successfully navigating the world of work”. We’re small, nimble, fast-paced and working on incredible futuristic things.


We were created to leverage disruptive innovation and with student experience at the forefront of our design, we strive to build world-class online learning experiences with our leading industry partners. And we have a bit of fun along the way.


Sounds great! Tell me about the role?


As a key member of the team, you are responsible for assuring the highest quality RMIT Online academic products across degrees, credentials and accreditation pathways, by working closely\xa0with the RMIT Leadership team, especially GMs of our Short Courses and Accredited portfolios.


In meeting our goal of building strategically aligned product portfolios, you will guide the development of new academic products to support emerging pathways and credentialing options to support our students’ success, through strong relationships with the university colleges.


Your role is fundamental to ensuring RMIT Online can successfully deliver value to lifelong learners and support non-traditional learning pathways as the university adapts to the shifting demands of the higher education market.


Other duties include:


  • Support the development and management of quality assurance and governance processes, in collaboration with the Uni, to ensure we deliver to TEQSA \xa0and other national and international standards.
  • Work with the DVCE and Education colleagues to develop the quality assurance frameworks to support innovation and excellence in accredited products and assessment design and delivery.
  • Support the establishment of academic engagement across RMIT Online, with the focus on developing the communication plans, relationships and processes to reduce escalations over time as new engagement models bed in, applying risk mitigation and escalation strategies, and advocating for excellence.


Let’s talk about you


With great knowledge and experience in curriculum design, accreditation, learning design, and innovative approaches in academic products and services, you find comfort in a collaborative and nimble work environment and culture.


You have strong exposure to accreditation processes and academic standards in the wider University sector and a proven track record building relationships with Academia and Industry, delivering high quality accredited programs combined with a passion to innovate in the sector.


Your achievements will include evidence of working on innovative programs and educational products with great Student Satisfaction outcomes. You’ve achieved this with your outstanding senior stakeholder engagement and management skills.


With your collaborative and effective working style, you know how to drive outputs and outcomes, enhance opportunities for collaboration, and influence outcomes.


Bonus points for a sense of humour, grace under pressure and a love of digital tech.


Ticking your boxes? Here's how to apply


Apply now! And send a brief cover letter telling us about:


  • Who you are and why we should choose you?
  • Your greatest achievement in innovating and building new educational products
  • What excites you about the future of online education and why?


Need more convincing?


You'll be stepping into our brand-new offices in the heart of the CBD, surrounded by a beautifully buzzing team of high achievers who are passionate, friendly and non-boring types.


RMIT Online provides breakfast daily, we invest in you, have an impressive annual leave offering and are breaking new ground in the online education space (and celebrating every step of the way!).

\xa0

\xa0

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.

\xa0

Job description

Leading International Consulting firm. Fantastic opportunity for a junior to intermediate level Infrastructure Analyst.


Note: we have 3 positions available!

The Infrastructure Analyst must be able strong team player able to work in a challenging environment and be able to support change within the organisation. The ideal candidate will bring previous experiences, best practices, and a collaborative attitude to help drive increased effectiveness in value and quality in workplace services.

  • Effective schedule management, financial management, risk and issues management and change management to the workplace projects within their support
  • Effectively leading the maintenance of project quality standards by implementing and ensuring adherence to relevant methodologies, processes and tools
  • Support the production of accurate and timely reporting on a weekly and monthly basis on project delivery
  • Continuous improvements to activities provided that support more efficient delivery of workplace projects


Assignment Deliverables

Provide a range of the services listed below to projects and programs in the overall workplace delivery program for the term of the SOW.

  • Program Support - Provide general program management support with raising and tracking of SOWs, purchase orders, invoicing and other financial and reporting processes.
  • Procurement support - Provide support for the procurement of workplace equipment for the Mac program, including completing Procurement governance activities, managing financials including obtaining approvals, reporting and asset management.
  • Service sourcing and commercial analysis - Provide analytic support for the service sourcing programs including reviewing and analysing commercial proposals and supporting business case development.


Specific technology skills and experience

Previous experience supporting an end user change programs in large, complex enterprise environments. Proven expertise against one or more of the following criteria:

  • Commercial / contractual experience – proven history of reviewing and analysing commercial documents
  • Process mapping and documentation
  • Facilitating and running process and technical workshops, to achieve specific outcomes
